design_row.description: React e-commerce storefront with product catalog and search

raw.summary: Webhook signature verification bypass in Stripe SDK. Allows attackers to forge payment webhooks and mark unpaid orders as paid.

design_row.description: Admin dashboard for inventory management and order fulfillment

raw.summary: Webhook signature verification bypass in Stripe SDK. Allows attackers to forge payment webhooks and mark unpaid orders as paid.

design_row.description: Product catalog search and recommendation engine

findings.message: SQL injection vulnerability in order search query. User-supplied order_id parameter is concatenated directly into SQL query without sanitization.

message.text: SQL injection vulnerability in order search query. User-supplied order_id parameter is concatenated directly into SQL query without sanitization.

findings.message: Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) in order details API. Users can view other customers' orders by manipulating order_id parameter.

message.text: Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) in order details API. Users can view other customers' orders by manipulating order_id parameter.

findings.message: Payment verification bypass in checkout flow. Client-side price validation allows attackers to modify order total before payment submission.

message.text: Payment verification bypass in checkout flow. Client-side price validation allows attackers to modify order total before payment submission.

findings.message: Session fixation vulnerability in user authentication. Session ID not regenerated after login allowing session hijacking attacks.

message.text: Session fixation vulnerability in user authentication. Session ID not regenerated after login allowing session hijacking attacks.

findings.message: Stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) in product review submission. User-supplied review content not sanitized before rendering on product pages.

message.text: Stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) in product review submission. User-supplied review content not sanitized before rendering on product pages.

findings.message: Hardcoded Stripe secret API key in payment processing code. Key is committed to Git repository and exposed in source code.

message.text: Hardcoded Stripe secret API key in payment processing code. Key is committed to Git repository and exposed in source code.

findings.message: Path traversal vulnerability in invoice download endpoint. Allows attackers to read arbitrary files from server including database credentials.

message.text: Path traversal vulnerability in invoice download endpoint. Allows attackers to read arbitrary files from server including database credentials.

findings.message: Mass assignment vulnerability in user profile update. Allows users to escalate privileges by setting is_admin field.

message.text: Mass assignment vulnerability in user profile update. Allows users to escalate privileges by setting is_admin field.

findings.message: Race condition in inventory management allows overselling. Multiple concurrent purchases can deplete inventory below zero.

message.text: Race condition in inventory management allows overselling. Multiple concurrent purchases can deplete inventory below zero.

findings.message: Credit card numbers logged in plaintext. Payment processing logs contain full PAN violating PCI DSS requirement 3.4.

message.text: Credit card numbers logged in plaintext. Payment processing logs contain full PAN violating PCI DSS requirement 3.4.

findings.message: Weak password policy allows passwords as short as 6 characters with no complexity requirements.

message.text: Weak password policy allows passwords as short as 6 characters with no complexity requirements.

findings.message: No rate limiting on checkout endpoint. Allows attackers to perform credential stuffing and payment fraud attempts.

message.text: No rate limiting on checkout endpoint. Allows attackers to perform credential stuffing and payment fraud attempts.

findings.message: CORS configured to allow all origins (*) with credentials. Allows cross-origin attacks on authenticated endpoints.

design_row.description: PostgreSQL storing customer accounts emails and addresses
MongoDB storing order history and transaction records
Product catalog inventory and pricing data
Redis for session management and cart persistence
Stripe and PayPal payment processing integration
FedEx UPS and USPS shipping label generation
Real-time inventory sync with warehouse management system
SendGrid for order confirmations and marketing emails
Customer behavior tracking and conversion analytics
CloudFront CDN for static assets and product images

non_cve_findings.message: SQL injection vulnerability in order search query. User-supplied order_id parameter is concatenated directly into SQL query without sanitization.
Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) in order details API. Users can view other customers' orders by manipulating order_id parameter.
Payment verification bypass in checkout flow. Client-side price validation allows attackers to modify order total before payment submission.
Session fixation vulnerability in user authentication. Session ID not regenerated after login allowing session hijacking attacks.
Stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) in product review submission. User-supplied review content not sanitized before rendering on product pages.
Hardcoded Stripe secret API key in payment processing code. Key is committed to Git repository and exposed in source code.
Path traversal vulnerability in invoice download endpoint. Allows attackers to read arbitrary files from server including database credentials.
Mass assignment vulnerability in user profile update. Allows users to escalate privileges by setting is_admin field.
Race condition in inventory management allows overselling. Multiple concurrent purchases can deplete inventory below zero.
Credit card numbers logged in plaintext. Payment processing logs contain full PAN violating PCI DSS requirement 3.4.

assertions.detail: CRITICAL: Active exploitation confirmed (KEV). Product search is internet-facing. RCE could allow attacker to access all customer PII and payment data. PCI DSS breach. IMMEDIATE PATCHING REQUIRED.
CRITICAL: Active exploitation confirmed (KEV). Seller dashboard allows image uploads. RCE could compromise entire platform. Emergency patch scheduled for tonight.
HIGH PRIORITY: Functional exploit available. Payment webhooks are internet-facing. Bypass = free merchandise. Financial fraud. PCI DSS violation. Upgrade scheduled for this week.
HIGH PRIORITY: Functional exploit available. Session hijacking = unauthorized access to customer accounts and payment methods. GDPR breach. Upgrade scheduled for this week.
HIGH PRIORITY: Functional exploit available. SSRF could expose AWS credentials and allow full account takeover. Upgrade scheduled for this week.
LOW PRIORITY: Command injection requires user-controlled Redis commands. Our implementation only uses GET/SET with server-generated keys. Scheduled for next maintenance window.
LOW PRIORITY: Prototype pollution requires user-controlled request config. Our implementation only makes requests to pre-configured shipping endpoints. Scheduled for next maintenance window.
MEDIUM PRIORITY: Code review in progress to determine exploitability. Upgrade planned for next sprint.

Run internal and external network vulnerability scans quarterly
Data Protection by Design and Default
Ensure all system components are protected from known vulnerabilities

web external pii internal CVE-2024-11111 high

api mission_critical public internet javascript/sql-injection SQL injection vulnerability in order search query. User-supplied order_id parameter is concatenated directly into SQL query without sanitization. api/order-management-service/src/controllers/order-controller.js javascript/idor Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) in order details API. Users can view other customers' orders by manipulating order_id parameter. api/order-management-service/src/routes/orders.js javascript/payment-bypass Payment verification bypass in checkout flow. Client-side price validation allows attackers to modify order total before payment submission. api/checkout-service/src/services/payment-processor.js javascript/session-fixation Session fixation vulnerability in user authentication. Session ID not regenerated after login allowing session hijacking attacks. api/user-service/src/auth/session-manager.js javascript/stored-xss Stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) in product review submission. User-supplied review content not sanitized before rendering on product pages. api/product-catalog-service/src/controllers/review-controller.js javascript/hardcoded-stripe-key Hardcoded Stripe secret API key in payment processing code. Key is committed to Git repository and exposed in source code. api/checkout-service/src/config/stripe-config.js javascript/path-traversal Path traversal vulnerability in invoice download endpoint. Allows attackers to read arbitrary files from server including database credentials. api/order-management-service/src/routes/invoices.js javascript/mass-assignment Mass assignment vulnerability in user profile update. Allows users to escalate privileges by setting is_admin field. api/user-service/src/controllers/profile-controller.js javascript/race-condition Race condition in inventory management allows overselling. Multiple concurrent purchases can deplete inventory below zero. api/cart-service/src/services/inventory-service.js javascript/credit-card-logging Credit card numbers logged in plaintext. Payment processing logs contain full PAN violating PCI DSS requirement 3.4. api/checkout-service/src/services/payment-logger.js javascript/weak-password-policy Weak password policy allows passwords as short as 6 characters with no complexity requirements. api/user-service/src/validation/password-validator.js javascript/missing-rate-limiting No rate limiting on checkout endpoint. Allows attackers to perform credential stuffing and payment fraud attempts. api/checkout-service/src/routes/checkout.js javascript/cors-misconfiguration CORS configured to allow all origins (*) with credentials. Allows cross-origin attacks on authenticated endpoints. api/cart-service/src/middleware/cors-config.js javascript/insecure-random Insecure random number generator (Math.random) used for discount code generation. Predictable codes allow unauthorized discounts. api/checkout-service/src/services/discount-service.js

properties.message: SQL injection vulnerability in order search query. User-supplied order_id parameter is concatenated directly into SQL query without sanitization.
Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) in order details API. Users can view other customers' orders by manipulating order_id parameter.
Payment verification bypass in checkout flow. Client-side price validation allows attackers to modify order total before payment submission.
Session fixation vulnerability in user authentication. Session ID not regenerated after login allowing session hijacking attacks.
Stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) in product review submission. User-supplied review content not sanitized before rendering on product pages.
Hardcoded Stripe secret API key in payment processing code. Key is committed to Git repository and exposed in source code.
Path traversal vulnerability in invoice download endpoint. Allows attackers to read arbitrary files from server including database credentials.
Mass assignment vulnerability in user profile update. Allows users to escalate privileges by setting is_admin field.
Race condition in inventory management allows overselling. Multiple concurrent purchases can deplete inventory below zero.
Credit card numbers logged in plaintext. Payment processing logs contain full PAN violating PCI DSS requirement 3.4.
Weak password policy allows passwords as short as 6 characters with no complexity requirements.
No rate limiting on checkout endpoint. Allows attackers to perform credential stuffing and payment fraud attempts.
CORS configured to allow all origins (*) with credentials. Allows cross-origin attacks on authenticated endpoints.
Insecure random number generator (Math.random) used for discount code generation. Predictable codes allow unauthorized discounts.

Data Protection by Design and Default

No rate limiting on checkout endpoint. Allows attackers to perform credential stuffing and payment fraud attempts.
CORS configured to allow all origins (*) with credentials. Allows cross-origin attacks on authenticated endpoints.
Insecure random number generator (Math.random) used for discount code generation. Predictable codes allow unauthorized discounts.

notes: Components likely to escalate: web, web, api, api, api
30% chance of reaching critical severity within 3 cycles
Stationary distribution retains high critical mass; long-term steady-state risk remains elevated
Estimated mixing time 61 steps exceeds remediation horizon; accelerate mitigations

insights: Projected MTTR improvement exceeds one day
Context engine evaluated 18 components for business impact

recommendations: Increase concurrency or disable heavy modules for near real-time execution
Backlog detected for 3 artefact(s); consider scaling ingestion workers
Prioritise high/critical findings queue to preserve response SLAs

enhanced_decision.summary: Consensus BLOCK at 84.5% confidence across 22 findings.

individual_analyses.reasoning: Detected 22 findings with peak severity CRITICAL. Guardrail status 'fail' requires escalation. Recommended action: BLOCK based on multi-signal weighting
